document.title: The Widening Gyre: Images as Central to the Global Village
document.abstract: The image is emerging as the lingua franca of technological culture, both resurrecting characteristics of pre-literate classicism and consolidating the global community.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Mark Smith is an Associate Professor of English at Valdosta State University, teaching professional writing and graduate-level courses in rhetoric and composition. He has published articles in Notes on Teaching English, The CEA Critic, and has an article in the forthcoming anthology, Teaching Vision: Language and Image in the Reading/Writing Classroom (Erlbaum, August 2001). He is presently contributing to a study of Walter Ong.
